segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on it, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s even aware of the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in a trance, just polishing and polishing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are right behind her, and she doesn’t even glance back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it a little funny how oblivious she is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, the stool is tipping, and she’s just drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she’s thinking about that’s so important.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe she’s just really dedicated to her chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Or maybe she’s just ignoring the chaos on purpose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Either way, it’s a funny scene to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
